lines.line_text: EACH saucy cit, who strolls from town,
With scorn surveys my gothic cell,
Or wond'ring asks, what sordid clown
In this drear solitude can dwell.

stanzas.stanza_text:
EACH saucy cit, who strolls from town,
With scorn surveys my gothic cell,
Or wond'ring asks, what sordid clown
In this drear solitude can dwell.

lines.line_text: These mould'ring walls, with ivy crown'd,
That charm  with their solemn scene,
These flow'rs that bloom spontaneous round,
Provoke his mirth, or raise his spleen.

stanzas.stanza_text:
These mould'ring walls, with ivy crown'd,
That charm  with their solemn scene,
These flow'rs that bloom spontaneous round,
Provoke his mirth, or raise his spleen.

lines.line_text: Inur'd to smoke, throughout the year
Yon verdant meads unmov'd he sees —
Those hills unsightly rocks appear —
You sacred groves,  heaps of trees. —

stanzas.stanza_text:
Inur'd to smoke, throughout the year
Yon verdant meads unmov'd he sees —
Those hills unsightly rocks appear —
You sacred groves,  heaps of trees. —

lines.line_text: The lucid fount, that murmuring falls,
Then thro' my shrubs meand'ring steals,
An useful stream the insipid calls, —
But no poetic rapture feels.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The lucid fount, that murmuring falls,
Then thro' my shrubs meand'ring steals,
An useful stream the insipid calls, —
But no poetic rapture feels.

lines.line_text: Hither from noisy crowds I fly;
Here dwells soft ease, and peace of mind; —
Yet think not Fancy's curious eye,
To these deep solitudes confin'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Hither from noisy crowds I fly;
Here dwells soft ease, and peace of mind; —
Yet think not Fancy's curious eye,
To these deep solitudes confin'd.

lines.line_text: Whene'er at morn or eve I rove,
Where yonder cliffs with pines are crown'd,
More splendid scenes my rapture move;
How charm'd I range th' horizon round.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Whene'er at morn or eve I rove,
Where yonder cliffs with pines are crown'd,
More splendid scenes my rapture move;
How charm'd I range th' horizon round.

lines.line_text: There Allen's stately columns rise,
And glittering from the circling wood,
With constant beauty feed my eyes,
As he the poor with constant food.

stanzas.stanza_text:
There Allen's stately columns rise,
And glittering from the circling wood,
With constant beauty feed my eyes,
As he the poor with constant food.

lines.line_text: Each pompous work, proud Bath! I share
That decks thy hills. — Well-pleas'd I see
Thy rising cirque eclipse thy square,
And Pitt and Stanhope build for me.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Each pompous work, proud Bath! I share
That decks thy hills. — Well-pleas'd I see
Thy rising cirque eclipse thy square,
And Pitt and Stanhope build for me.

lines.line_text: Here Bathurst's high aërial seat,
There Seymour's lofty groves are
And Riggs's elegant retreat
Adorns the variegated

stanzas.stanza_text:
Here Bathurst's high aërial seat,
There Seymour's lofty groves are
And Riggs's elegant retreat
Adorns the variegated

lines.line_text: Would I fair Eden's bloom restore!
Lo! Widcomb's cultivated vale,
Where Flora paints her slopes for Moore,
And all Arabia's sweets exhale.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Would I fair Eden's bloom restore!
Lo! Widcomb's cultivated vale,
Where Flora paints her slopes for Moore,
And all Arabia's sweets exhale.

lines.line_text: Luxurious thus I freely rove,
Nor at the sons of wealth repine;
Mere tenant of each hill and grove,
Which sovereign Fancy renders mine.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Luxurious thus I freely rove,
Nor at the sons of wealth repine;
Mere tenant of each hill and grove,
Which sovereign Fancy renders mine.

lines.line_text: Familiar grown by constant use,
The stateliest dome its master cloys —
Then grant him but these transient views,
What you possess, the bard enjoys.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Familiar grown by constant use,
The stateliest dome its master cloys —
Then grant him but these transient views,
What you possess, the bard enjoys.
